item.title: How do you stop monsters attacking back when you hit them?
item.dc:creator: @Noob.Coder Noob.Coder
item.description:
@Noob.Coder wrote:

Um, most people would want the monsters to hit back but hold on a minute and I’ll get the code for you.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 02, 2008, 10:10:37 am[/size][hr]Hmmm, I can’t find the code in my own client.java or player.java or npchandler.java. I’ll look harder for you but it might take a while. Please hold.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 02, 2008, 10:15:22 am[/size][hr]Ok, I think I’ve found it;
BACKUP YOUR FILES BEFORE DOING THIS BECAUSE I THINK THIS IS IT! In NPCHandler.java;

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1158 || npcs[i].npcType == 2745) { npcs[i].StartKilling = person.playerId; npcs[i].RandomWalk = false; npcs[i].IsUnderAttack = true; } else if (person.distanceToPoint( npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY) >= 21 || person.heightLevel != npcs[i].heightLevel) { if (npcs[i].npcType == 1158 || npcs[i].npcType == 2745) { npcs[i].RandomWalk = true; } } } } } }
Try and delete that and replace it with:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1158 || npcs[i].npcType == 2745) { npcs[i].RandomWalk = false; npcs[i].IsUnderAttack = true; } else if (person.distanceToPoint( npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY) >= 21 || person.heightLevel != npcs[i].heightLevel) { if (npcs[i].npcType == 1158 || npcs[i].npcType == 2745) { npcs[i].RandomWalk = true; } } } } } } [big][b]REMEMBER BACKUP YOUR FILES BEFORE YOU DO THIS!
